page.title: 12BIRDS IN E.NORFOLK
page.content: The marshes of East Norfolk attract a number of unusual birds.Each year rare migrant species are recorded, although not as many as on the North Norfolk coast.In the reed beds at Burgh Castle it is sometimes posible to detect the metallic call of the Bearded tit (or reedling).This exotic looking little bird is at the extreme northern edge of its range and suffers badly in severe winters. The marshes are also home for Water Rail,Hen Harrier,Marsh Harrier, Grey Heron,shelduck,redshank,bittern, several species of wildfowl and grebe.Drainage of the marshland has caused loss of habitat and concern from local naturalists.
